result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Anne Renc
Status conference on September 8, 2022 at 11:30 am.

9:33 AM Defendant Kerry D Kluck in court.  Attorney Richard E. Bender appeared by video for Kerry D Kluck.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
All files heard: 21CF453, 21CF463, 21CF465, 21CF476, 22CF214, 22CF217, 22CF232, 22CF273, 22CF274, 22CF304, 22CF305, 22CF343, 22CF373, 22CF402.

Atty Mutchler notes a new case (22CF402) was filed yesterday along with the Motion to Modify Bond on 22CF373.
Court questions Atty Bender. 
Atty Bender notes he has been appointed on his earlier cases.  He filed a motion to withdraw and the public defender is looking to appoint new counsel but has not been successful as of yet. 
Court makes statements.  Asks if he is willing to accept appointment on all of Mr. Kluck's cases. 
Atty Bender states he is not.   He is a solo practice and cannot take on more caseload.  
Atty Mutchler indicates Atty Bender is representing him on the 2021 cases only.  
Atty Bender again states is not willing to accept the appointment on more cases. 
Atty Mutchler states they reached out to Atty Drury from the public defenders office.  
Court notes there were 715 contacts either by phone, email or face to face. 
Court addresses the defendant.  Motion to forfeit the cash bail was filed.  Court is hesitant to move forward on that motion without him having representation. 
Court will be contact the public defender again.  If they are not able to find an attorney, court will seriously consider appointing counsel for him at county expense, however, the cash posted, should there be convictions at the conclusions and the cash remain, the court would seek that that be reimbursed to the county so the county doesn't incur additional costs.

Court will set the matters for another status conference. 
BY THE COURT:  Atty Bender is allowed to appear by zoom. 

Defendant makes statements, questions why the court is not appointing counsel today. 
Court responds.  

Atty Bender states it is his intention to withdraw from the 4 cases he has once counsel is appointed on the balance of the cases.
Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 11:30 am.
State's Notice of Motion and Motion to Forfeit Cash Bail filed by the State (sent to Br 3 Judge/JA on 08/23/22 sp)
Status Report from JusticePoint dated 08/23/22
Violation Report from JusticePoint dated 08/17/22
Motion hearing on August 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.

1:36 PM Defendant Kerry D Kluck in court, in custody. Assistant District Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin.  Cases: 2021CF000453, 2021CF000463, 2021CF000465, 2021CF000476, 2022CF000214, 22CF217, 2022CF000232, 2022CF000273, 2022CF000274, 2022CF000304, 2022CF000305, 2022CF000343, and 2022CF000373.
Court addresses the Motion for Counsel. Court will not proceed with the motions to forfeit bonds or the defendant's motion to amend bond.
Court will be contacting the public defender's office to verify the status of assigning an attorney.
If the jail moves him to Waupaca, Court will have no problem having the defendant appear by Zoom.
Motion hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.
**See Minutes from Adjourned Initial Appearance held on 08/08/22**

Initial Appearance set for August 8, 2022 @ 2:30 p.m. in Br 1

Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons, including pocket knives.

Follow all open bonds in all open cases.

11:02 AM Defendant Kerry David Kluck appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Taylor Soule appears in court on behalf of Defendant for today's hearing.

Court calls case.
Atty Mutchler states appearances.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Mutchler states facts for anticipated multiple charges of bailjumping. 
Attorney Soule for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
No victim wish to make a statement.

State requests a cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Attorney for the defendant objects to cash bond and states reasons on the record. 

Defendant   is   eligible for public defender representation.
Hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
